intro: Ruschia leightoniae, commonly known as the Cape tulip, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range from yellow to orange in color. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Its foliage consists of fleshy, succulent leaves that help it store water, adapting it to arid environments. Ruschia leightoniae is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant blooms and drought tolerance.
